songTitle: Bát bồng, nhất trò, xuân nữ

phrases.text: Chầu rày đã có trăng non
phrases.english: Now there is a new moon

culturalContext.description: Opening with lunar imagery common in Vietnamese folk songs
facts: Lunar calendar central to Vietnamese culture and traditional timekeeping
Trăng non (new moon) marks beginning of lunar month
Moon imagery often symbolizes romance and longing in folk poetry
culturalContext.musicalContext: Sets temporal and romantic context for narrative

phrases.text: Để anh lên xuống mà có con em bồng
phrases.english: So I can go up and down to have you to carry

culturalContext.description: Romantic imagery of courtship and care
facts: Bồng means to carry someone tenderly (often children or loved ones)
Going up and down may reference visiting between villages or social visits
Use of kinship terms (anh/em) common in romantic Vietnamese poetry
culturalContext.musicalContext: Establishes romantic relationship between singer and subject

phrases.text: Đi đâu mà sách đi hoài
phrases.english: Where are you going with books constantly?

culturalContext.description: Shift to questioning about scholarly pursuits
facts: Transition from romantic to social commentary typical of bài chòi
Books symbolize pursuit of education and social mobility
Question format invites audience participation in performance
culturalContext.musicalContext: Thematic shift marked by question, creating dialogue structure

phrases.text: Cử nhân chẳng có mà tú tài cũng không
phrases.english: No bachelor's degree and no laureate either

facts: References traditional examination system (abolished early 1900s)
Social humor about educated but unsuccessful scholars common theme
Reflects reality that many studied but few passed imperial exams
culturalContext.musicalContext: Answer phrase with parallel negation structure

phrases.text: Đi đâu mang sách đi hoài
phrases.english: Where are you going, always carrying books?

facts: Refrain structure common in folk songs for audience participation
Repetition reinforces irony of continuous study without success
culturalContext.musicalContext: Musical refrain provides familiar anchor point

phrases.text: Cử nhân không đậu tú tài cũng không
phrases.english: Neither pass bachelor's nor laureate exam

facts: Parallel structure with earlier phrase maintains musical continuity
Repetition amplifies social commentary through musical emphasis

phrases.text: Dù không ngon cũng bánh ít lá gai
phrases.english: Even if not delicious, still sticky rice cake with spiky leaves

culturalContext.description: Food metaphor asserting value despite imperfection
facts: Bánh ít lá gai is Central Vietnamese delicacy
Metaphor: modest worth better than no worth
Shift from failure to self-affirmation

phrases.text: Dù anh có dại cũng trai trò học trò
phrases.english: Even if foolish, still a student, still a scholar

facts: Parallel with food metaphor (both use Dù...cũng structure)
Trò học trò - reduplication emphasizes enduring identity as learner
Vietnamese cultural value: persistence in education despite results
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing refrain with poetic repetition provides musical and thematic closure
